name: Avocado
description: A creamy, nutrient-dense fruit known for its healthy fats, commonly used in guacamole, salads, and sandwiches.

name: Asparagus
description: A spear-like vegetable with a delicate flavor, commonly steamed, grilled, or roasted.

name: Artichoke
description: A tender, edible flower bud with a nutty flavor, often steamed or grilled.

name: Sweet Potato
description: A starchy root with a sweet flavor, often baked, mashed, or used in casseroles.

name: Onion
description: A flavorful bulb vegetable commonly used in cooking as a base for many dishes.

name: Apple
description: A sweet, crisp fruit available in many varieties, often eaten raw or used in cooking.

name: Banana
description: A tropical fruit with a sweet taste and creamy texture, often eaten raw or used in smoothies and desserts.

name: Tomato
description: A juicy red fruit, widely considered a vegetable for culinary purposes, commonly used in salads, sauces, and cooking.

name: Carrot
description: A root commonly orange in color, known for its crisp texture and slightly sweet flavor, used in soups, salads, and snacks.

name: Broccoli
description: A green vegetable known for its dense florets and high nutritional content, often steamed or stir-fried.

name: Spinach
description: A leafy green vegetable, rich in iron and other nutrients, often used in salads, smoothies, and cooked dishes.

name: Potato
description: A starchy tuber, often used in various forms such as mashed, baked, or fried.

name: Garlic
description: A pungent bulb used as a seasoning in many dishes, particularly in Mediterranean and Asian cuisines.

name: Strawberry
description: A sweet and juicy red fruit, often eaten fresh or used in desserts, known for its characteristic flavor and aroma.

name: Blueberry
description: A small, blue-purple fruit known for its high antioxidant content, often eaten fresh or in smoothies and baked goods.

name: Pineapple
description: A tropical fruit with a spiky exterior and sweet, juicy flesh. It is commonly eaten fresh or used in cooking.

name: Mango
description: A tropical stone fruit known for its sweet, juicy flesh and bright orange color, often eaten raw or used in smoothies and desserts.

name: Peach
description: A juicy, sweet stone fruit with a velvety skin, often eaten fresh or used in desserts and salads.

name: Pear
description: A sweet, juicy fruit with a soft texture, often eaten fresh or used in desserts and salads.

name: Watermelon
description: A large, juicy fruit with a green rind and red flesh, commonly eaten fresh during the summer for its refreshing sweetness.

name: Cucumber
description: A refreshing, crisp vegetable commonly used in salads and pickles, known for its high water content.

name: Lettuce
description: A leafy green vegetable commonly used in salads and sandwiches for its crisp texture and mild flavor.

name: Celery
description: A crunchy, low-calorie vegetable commonly eaten raw or used in soups, salads, and stir-fries.

name: Bell Pepper
description: A sweet, mild pepper available in various colors, commonly used in salads, stir-fries, and as a raw snack.

name: Zucchini
description: A summer squash with a mild flavor, often grilled, sautéed, or baked in a variety of dishes.

name: Pumpkin
description: A large, orange squash with a sweet flavor, commonly used in pies, soups, and roasted dishes.

name: Squash
description: A variety of gourds that come in different shapes and sizes, often roasted or used in soups and casseroles.

name: Kale
description: A leafy green vegetable known for its nutrient density, often used in salads, smoothies, and soups.

name: Cauliflower
description: A cruciferous vegetable with a mild flavor, often used as a low-carb substitute for rice or mashed potatoes.

name: Brussels Sprouts
description: A small, cabbage-like vegetable that is often roasted or sautéed and served as a side dish.

name: Radish
description: A crunchy, peppery root often eaten raw in salads or as a garnish.

name: Beetroot
description: A sweet, earthy root commonly roasted or used in salads and smoothies.

name: Chili Pepper
description: A spicy vegetable used in various cuisines around the world to add heat and flavor to dishes.

name: Ginger
description: A pungent, spicy root used as a flavoring agent in a variety of cuisines, especially in Asian dishes.

name: Lemon
description: A sour citrus fruit, commonly used for its juice in drinks, marinades, and dressings.

name: Lime
description: A tart, green citrus fruit used in cooking, drinks, and as a flavor enhancer in various dishes.

name: Orange
description: A sweet and juicy citrus fruit, rich in Vitamin C, commonly eaten raw or juiced.

name: Grapefruit
description: A large, tart citrus fruit often eaten fresh or used in juices, salads, and desserts.

name: Kiwi
description: A small, fuzzy fruit with bright green flesh, known for its sweet and tangy flavor.

name: Papaya
description: A tropical fruit with sweet orange flesh, commonly eaten fresh or used in smoothies and salads.

name: Cabbage
description: A leafy green or purple vegetable commonly used in salads, stir-fries, and fermented dishes like sauerkraut.

name: Turnip
description: A root with a mildly spicy flavor, often used in soups, stews, and roasted dishes.

name: Butternut Squash
description: A sweet, nutty winter squash with a rich, creamy texture, commonly roasted or used in soups.

name: Eggplant
description: A purple vegetable with a meaty texture, often used in grilled dishes, casseroles, or stews.

name: Fennel
description: A flavorful bulb vegetable with a mild licorice taste, often used in salads, soups, and roasted dishes.

name: Artichoke
description: A tender, edible flower bud with a nutty flavor, often steamed or grilled.

name: Leek
description: A mild, onion-like vegetable used in soups, stews, and sautéed dishes.

name: Shallot
description: A small, flavorful bulb related to onions, often used in gourmet dishes and dressings.

name: Corn
description: A starchy vegetable with a sweet flavor, commonly eaten as a side dish or used in soups, salads, and salsas.

name: Peas
description: Small, sweet green legumes often eaten as a side dish or used in soups, stews, and salads.

name: Green Beans
description: A crisp, green vegetable often eaten steamed or sautéed as a side dish.

name: Chickpeas
description: A small, round legume often used in Mediterranean and Middle Eastern dishes like hummus and falafel.

name: Lentils
description: A small, lens-shaped legume commonly used in soups, stews, and salads.

name: Raspberries
description: A sweet, tart berry often eaten fresh or used in desserts, jams, and smoothies.

name: Blackberries
description: A dark, sweet berry with a slightly tart flavor, often used in desserts, jams, and smoothies.

name: Cranberries
description: A tart red berry often used in sauces, juices, and baked goods, known for its high antioxidant content.

name: Gooseberries
description: A tart and slightly sweet berry, often used in jams, pies, and desserts.

name: Mulberries
description: A sweet, juicy berry that can be eaten raw, dried, or used in jams and desserts.

name: Apricot
description: A small, sweet fruit with a soft, velvety skin and a juicy flesh, often eaten fresh or dried.

name: Plum
description: A juicy stone fruit with a sweet or tart flavor, commonly eaten fresh or dried.

name: Grapes
description: Small, sweet or tart berries that are eaten fresh, dried into raisins, or used to make wine.

name: Fig
description: A sweet fruit with a soft, chewy texture and small edible seeds, often eaten fresh or dried.

name: Date
description: A sweet, chewy fruit that is often dried and eaten as a snack or used in desserts.

name: Pomegranate
description: A round fruit with tough skin and juicy seeds, often eaten fresh or used in juices and salads.

name: Cantaloupe
description: A sweet, juicy melon with orange flesh, commonly eaten fresh as a snack or in salads.

name: Honeydew
description: A sweet melon with pale green flesh, often eaten fresh in fruit salads or as a snack.

name: Coconut
description: A large, hard-shelled fruit with sweet water and edible white flesh, used in cooking and as a snack.

name: Olive
description: A small, bitter fruit often cured and eaten as a snack or pressed to make olive oil.

name: Chestnut
description: A sweet, edible nut that is often roasted and eaten as a snack or used in cooking.

name: Walnut
description: A rich, flavorful nut often eaten as a snack or used in baked goods and salads.

name: Almond
description: A crunchy, nutrient-dense nut that is often eaten as a snack or used in baking.

name: Hazelnut
description: A small, sweet nut often eaten roasted or used in confectioneries like chocolate and pralines.

name: Pistachio
description: A small, green nut that is often eaten as a snack or used in desserts and baking.

name: Cashew
description: A sweet, soft-textured nut often eaten as a snack or used in cooking and baking.

name: Macadamia
description: A rich, buttery nut that is often eaten as a snack or used in baking.

name: Tangerine
description: A small, sweet citrus fruit with easy-to-peel skin, often eaten fresh or used in salads.

name: Clementine
description: A sweet, seedless citrus fruit with easy-to-peel skin, often eaten as a snack or used in desserts.

name: Satsuma
description: A seedless and easy-to-peel citrus fruit with a sweet, mild flavor, often eaten fresh.

name: Durian
description: A large tropical fruit known for its strong smell and creamy texture, often used in desserts.

name: Jackfruit
description: A large tropical fruit with a sweet, fibrous flesh, often eaten raw or used in savory dishes.

name: Rhubarb
description: A tart, red stalk often used in pies, jams, and desserts.

name: Bok Choy
description: A type of Chinese cabbage with crisp, mild-flavored stalks, often used in stir-fries and soups.

name: Collard Greens
description: A leafy green vegetable with a mild flavor, often used in Southern cooking and stews.

name: Swiss Chard
description: A leafy green vegetable with colorful stalks, often sautéed or used in soups and salads.

name: Endive
description: A bitter, leafy vegetable often used in salads or as a garnish.

name: Radicchio
description: A red, bitter leafy vegetable often used in salads or grilled as a side dish.

name: Watercress
description: A peppery, leafy green often used in salads or as a garnish.

name: Arugula
description: A peppery, leafy green often used in salads, sandwiches, and as a garnish.

name: Dandelion Greens
description: A bitter, leafy green vegetable often used in salads or sautéed as a side dish.

name: Mustard Greens
description: A peppery, leafy green vegetable often used in Southern cooking and salads.

name: Sorrel
description: A tangy, leafy green often used in soups, sauces, and salads.

name: Okra
description: A green, pod-like vegetable often used in soups, stews, and fried dishes.

name: Parsley
description: A fresh, peppery herb commonly used as a garnish or in sauces and dressings.

name: Basil
description: A fragrant herb often used in Italian cooking, especially in pesto and tomato dishes.

name: Mint
description: A fresh, cooling herb commonly used in teas, desserts, and Middle Eastern dishes.

name: Thyme
description: A woody herb with small, fragrant leaves, often used in Mediterranean and French cooking.

name: Oregano
description: A strong, peppery herb often used in Italian and Greek cooking, especially in tomato-based sauces.

name: Sage
description: A fragrant herb with a slightly peppery flavor, often used in stuffing, meats, and sauces.

name: Rosemary
description: A fragrant herb with needle-like leaves, often used in roasted meats and potatoes.

name: Dill
description: A feathery herb with a fresh, tangy flavor, often used in pickling and sauces.

name: Tarragon
description: A fragrant herb with a slight licorice flavor, often used in French cuisine and vinegar-based sauces.

name: Chervil
description: A delicate herb with a mild flavor, often used in French cooking and as a garnish.

name: Coriander
description: A fragrant herb commonly used in Indian, Middle Eastern, and Mexican cuisines.

name: Fennel Seed
description: A small, aromatic seed with a licorice-like flavor, often used in Italian sausages and breads.

name: Caraway
description: A small, aromatic seed with a peppery flavor, often used in breads, sausages, and cheeses.

name: Cumin
description: A small, aromatic seed with a warm, earthy flavor, often used in Indian, Mexican, and Middle Eastern cuisines.

name: Anise
description: A small, aromatic seed with a licorice-like flavor, often used in baking and liqueurs.

name: Cardamom
description: A small, aromatic seed pod with a sweet, floral flavor, often used in Indian and Middle Eastern cooking.

name: Clove
description: A small, aromatic flower bud with a warm, spicy flavor, often used in baking and beverages.

name: Vanilla
description: A fragrant spice derived from the seed pods of orchids, often used in baking and desserts.

name: Cinnamon
description: A fragrant spice made from the inner bark of trees, often used in baking and beverages.

name: Bay Leaf
description: A fragrant leaf often used in soups, stews, and sauces for its aromatic qualities.

name: Chive
description: A mild, onion-like herb often used as a garnish or in soups and salads.

name: Marjoram
description: A mild, sweet herb often used in Mediterranean cooking, especially in meats and soups.

name: Lavender
description: A fragrant herb with a floral flavor, often used in desserts and beverages.

name: Peppermint
description: A cooling herb often used in teas, desserts, and beverages for its refreshing flavor.

name: Spearmint
description: A cooling, fragrant herb often used in teas, sauces, and desserts.

name: Lemongrass
description: A fragrant grass with a citrus flavor, often used in Southeast Asian cooking and teas.

name: Galangal
description: A root spice with a peppery, citrus flavor, often used in Southeast Asian curries and soups.

name: Turmeric
description: A root spice with a warm, earthy flavor and vibrant yellow color, often used in Indian cooking.

name: Horseradish
description: A pungent root spice often grated and used in sauces and dressings for its sharp flavor.

name: Jicama
description: A crisp, starchy root with a slightly sweet flavor, often eaten raw in salads or cooked in stir-fries.

name: Kohlrabi
description: A bulbous vegetable with a mild, slightly sweet flavor, often eaten raw in salads or cooked in stir-fries.

name: Daikon
description: A large, white radish with a mild, peppery flavor, often eaten raw, pickled, or cooked in soups and stews.

name: Parsnip
description: A sweet, starchy root with a nutty flavor, often roasted, mashed, or used in soups and stews.

name: Cassava
description: A starchy root with a mild flavor, often used in tropical cooking as a substitute for potatoes or in making tapioca.

name: Jerusalem Artichoke
description: A knobby root with a nutty flavor, often used in soups, stews, or roasted.

name: Sunchoke
description: Another name for Jerusalem artichoke, with a slightly sweet, nutty flavor, often eaten roasted or used in soups.

name: Lotus Root
description: A starchy root with a mild, slightly sweet flavor, often used in Asian soups and stir-fries.

name: Bamboo Shoots
description: Young bamboo sprouts with a mild flavor and crunchy texture, often used in Asian stir-fries and soups.

name: Mushroom
description: A wide variety of edible fungi, often used in soups, stir-fries, and salads for their umami flavor.

name: Truffle
description: A highly prized edible fungus with an intense, earthy flavor, often shaved over dishes as a finishing touch.

name: Seaweed
description: Edible marine algae often used in sushi, salads, and soups for its umami flavor and high iodine content.

name: Nori
description: A type of edible seaweed commonly used to wrap sushi and as a garnish in soups.

name: Dulse
description: A type of red seaweed with a slightly salty taste, often used in soups, salads, and as a snack.

name: Kelp
description: A type of brown seaweed often used in soups, sushi, and as a source of iodine.

name: Spirulina
description: A blue-green algae rich in protein and often used as a dietary supplement or in smoothies.

name: Alfalfa
description: A nutrient-rich sprout often used in salads and sandwiches for its mild, fresh taste.

name: Sprouts
description: A variety of sprouted seeds and beans, such as mung bean or lentil sprouts, often used in salads and sandwiches.

name: Broccoli Rabe
description: A bitter leafy green vegetable with small broccoli-like florets, often sautéed or steamed.

name: Rapini
description: A bitter leafy green vegetable similar to broccoli rabe, often used in Italian cooking.

name: Scallion
description: A green onion with a mild flavor, often used raw in salads or as a garnish.

name: spring Onion
description: A young onion with a mild flavor, often used in salads and as a garnish.

name: Chard
description: A leafy green vegetable often used in Mediterranean cooking, sautéed or used in soups and salads.

name: Purslane
description: A leafy green with a slightly sour and salty flavor, often used in salads and Mediterranean dishes.

name: Fiddlehead Fern
description: The young, coiled shoots of a fern, often sautéed or steamed and used in salads or as a side dish.

name: Romaine Lettuce
description: A leafy green lettuce with crisp texture, often used in salads, particularly Caesar salads.

name: Iceberg Lettuce
description: A crisp, watery lettuce often used in salads and sandwiches for its mild flavor and crunch.

name: Butterhead Lettuce
description: A soft, leafy green lettuce known for its tender texture and mild flavor, often used in salads.

name: Mizuna
description: A leafy green with a mild peppery flavor, often used in salads and stir-fries.

name: Tatsoi
description: A leafy green with a mild flavor and tender texture, often used in salads or as a side dish.

name: Epazote
description: A pungent herb often used in Mexican cooking, particularly in bean dishes to reduce gas.

name: Salsify
description: A root with a mild, oyster-like flavor, often boiled or mashed.

name: Ulluco
description: A brightly colored tuber with a waxy texture, often used in soups or stews in South American cuisine.

name: Malanga
description: A starchy root similar to taro, often used in Caribbean and Latin American cooking.

name: Chayote
description: A mild, crunchy squash often used in soups, salads, and stir-fries in Latin American cuisine.

name: Cress
description: A peppery, leafy green often used in salads or as a garnish.

name: Nopales
description: Edible cactus paddles commonly used in Mexican cuisine, often sautéed or grilled.

name: Pepino
description: A sweet, melon-like fruit often eaten fresh or used in fruit salads in South American cuisine.

name: Sapote
description: A tropical fruit with sweet, creamy flesh, often eaten fresh or used in smoothies and desserts.

name: Persimmon
description: A sweet, honey-like fruit with a smooth, firm texture, often eaten fresh or used in desserts.

name: Starfruit
description: A tropical fruit with a sweet, tangy flavor and a unique star-shaped cross section, often eaten fresh or used in salads.

name: Dragonfruit
description: A vibrant tropical fruit with a mildly sweet flavor and striking appearance, often eaten fresh or used in smoothies.

name: Lychee
description: A small, tropical fruit with a fragrant, sweet flavor, often eaten fresh or used in desserts and beverages.

name: Longan
description: A small, round tropical fruit similar to lychee, with a sweet, musky flavor, often eaten fresh.

name: Rambutan
description: A spiny, tropical fruit similar to lychee with a sweet, juicy flavor, often eaten fresh.

name: Mangosteen
description: A small, tropical fruit with a sweet, tangy flavor and soft, white flesh, often eaten fresh.

name: Passion fruit
description: A tropical fruit with a tart, fragrant flavor, often used in juices, desserts, and smoothies.

name: Acerola
description: A small, bright red tropical fruit with a tart flavor, often used in juices and jams for its high vitamin C content.

name: Tamarind
description: A tropical fruit with a tangy-sweet flavor, often used in sauces, candies, and beverages.

name: Guava
description: A tropical fruit with a sweet, fragrant flavor, often eaten fresh or used in juices and desserts.

name: Quince
description: A firm, aromatic fruit with a tart flavor, often used in jams, jellies, and desserts.

name: Cactus Pear
description: A sweet, fleshy fruit from the prickly pear cactus, often eaten fresh or used in beverages and jams.

name: Feijoa
description: A small, oval-shaped fruit with a sweet, tangy flavor, often eaten fresh or used in jams and jellies.

name: Jabuticaba
description: A small, dark purple fruit with a sweet flavor, often eaten fresh or used in jellies, wines, and liqueurs.

name: Ackee
description: A pear-shaped tropical fruit with creamy, nutty flesh, often cooked and used in savory dishes in Caribbean cuisine.

name: Breadfruit
description: A starchy tropical fruit with a texture similar to bread when cooked, often roasted, baked, or boiled.

name: Plantain
description: A starchy fruit similar to a banana, often cooked and used in savory dishes or fried as a snack.

name: Sugarcane
description: A tall grass that produces a sweet juice, often processed into sugar or used in beverages.

name: Kumquat
description: A small, tart citrus fruit with an edible peel, often eaten whole or used in preserves and marmalades.

name: Loquat
description: A small, sweet fruit with a flavor similar to peaches or apricots, often eaten fresh or used in jams and desserts.

name: Jujube
description: A small, sweet fruit with a chewy texture, often eaten fresh, dried, or used in teas and desserts.

name: Medlar
description: A small, brown fruit with a tart flavor, often eaten after bletting or used in jams and jellies.

name: Mulberry
description: A sweet, juicy berry often eaten fresh or used in jams, pies, and wines.
